1111113.content:
It had been a busy few years since 'The Incredibles' had defeated Syndrome. With the government flip flopping before admitting that Supers could do good, and should be free to do good. The endless litigation was dealt with more sensibly and a few examples made for those bringing malicious and petty cases to clog up the court system.

It was an odd childhood, with herself and Dash going with their parents out at night to deal with criminals, under proper parental supervision. None of the children were allowed to work on their own, and with the Government already having a database of the Supers, it easy for them to keep a soft touch approach, with guidance and support.

Violet and Dash, sat in, as observers on their parents annual performance review. "Not Judging." was all the men in dark suits and sunglasses said when questioned, that and "Only here to help.", and according to both their parents, they kept their word.

While the feeling of oversight wasn't pleasant, the reason was clear when six months later, Captain Mysterio went wild. The government was needed, and the other Supers rallied around to help capture and contain him. As she just passed her eighteenth birthday, she was free to act as a Super on her own, with her experience, and the support from Area 51, she was ready.

- - - - -

Looking around her University dorm room, she didn't feel ready. She'd never felt more alone, and uncertain in her life. She'd brought down a few robbers, but never felt she was making that big a difference. A few stories mentioned 'The Force', an askew smile forming on her face, initially, it was 'Force Boy', a name that had to change after a few weeks, when better pictures became available, and the news didn't have to rely on grainy CCTV footage.

'Perhaps, that was part of it.', Violet thought. She'd never been as curvy as her mother, never as confident. So she didn't feel she was putting aside a great responsibility. Hell, the news stations didn't even know she could turn invisible. Not really a surprise, given it's nature.

So she half-hoped that 'The Force' could fade from public consciousness, and Violet Parr would be able to emerge on her own, to define her own life. Looking over the small shelf, she read the titles of her coursebooks.

Despite her hopes, she still had her scarlet Super suit, in the false bottom of a case, jammed under the bed.

The Sun shone in the window, and her mood lightened. She decided to throw herself into her studies, and make that, allow that to fill her life. With a genuine smile spreading across her face, she spotted the postcard that had been slipped beneath the dorm-room door.

A half-hearted sigh slipped out, as she got off the bed to pick it up. Elasticity felt like a great power to have, in everyday life. She assumed it was a duty rota for cleaning, or getting the rubbish picked up, or some mundane activity. But as she turned it over, she couldn't see any writing on it. Well, beyond her name, on one side, and filling the opposite face a picture of a black Labrador.

https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/564...

It felt odd, but jamming it into the frame of her mirror, she found she liked it. There weren't many cosmetics on the table by the mirror, but she was getting more familiar and more confident with using them.
1111113.title: Violet Parr at University...

choices: Violet phoned home, as soon as the lecture finished.
Violet raced back to her room, that postcard, and a proper mirror.
As Violet walked, in a daze, a friendly puppy sniffed her with its damp nose.
11111132.content:
As Violet's hand reached for her hair, she wondered if it needed a good shampooing. But that thought had to be put aside, as the alarm rang on her smart phone. She only had ten minutes to get to her lecture. A summary of the French subjunctive tense, a subject she struggled with, and one she didn't want to antagonise her lecturer by arriving late.

Quickly, she scooped up her books, and bag stuffing them in beside her computer and her own notes. She tried to dismiss the itch from her ears, as a distraction to be ignored. Running to the lecture hall, she was glad to see she'd beaten Prof. Lincoln, to the hall. Finding a good seat, near the middle, she set herself up.

The lecture was as incomprehensible as she'd expected, even with the notes projected and the examples illustrated, she felt frustrated.

But, it was the distracting itch, that finally broke her. An hour into the lecture, she couldn't pretend it was going away. Angrily she scuffed at the irritation. It was then that she found the problem, as her ears flapped beneath her hair more than they should. Snatching her hand away, she put her hands in her lap, for a moment. Her feverish scratching, drawing a few distracted eyes.

However, it was only a momentary respite, as her hand slid up to feel her ears, to confirm or disprove her suspicions. A squeak of fear slipped out, as she felt her ears. They felt much hairier, than they should, and more mobile, like flaps of skin. Checking her reflection in the black mirror of her mobile phone, she confirmed it.

Beneath her mane, of straight black hair, she now had canine ears. In fact, the same sort as she'd expect to find on a black lab. She snorted, as she made the connection with that odd postcard. Nervously, she allowed her now trembling hands to drop into her lap. Checking again, she confirmed that her new canine ears were hidden beneath that hair. Thankfully, the changes were invisible to anyone else.

"Texting, Miss Parr." The lecturer's voice loud and clear in the hall. Not so much a question, more an accusation.

"Sorry." she answered blushing shaking her head, but not denying it. She hated public attention without her mask and secret identity to hide behind. Already the focus of too much attention, she sat distractedly through the rest of the lecture.
11111132.title: Violet scratched her ears, distractedly. 'W...

111111323.content:
Knowing she needed to investigate this, and afraid there was more changes to come. Her hands had roamed for the rest of the lecture, probing for further changes, or hints that anything else might be imminent.

Despite not finding anything else off. A few voices called after her, as she slipped in the opposite direction to the next class. A dismissive wave of her hand, and a vague gesture were enough to satisfy her new friends. It was still the first week, of the semester, and friendships broke and formed quickly.

As she crossed between, the university lab, and passed through the park towards the dormitories the wind picked up. Leaves flurried and danced around her. Violet almost walked into the woman with her dog. She apologised eager to get back to her dorm room. There was a nod of the head, from the ... woman?

Violet couldn't make out any features. With a long coat, and the neck folded high against the wind. The woman grabbed at her hat the brim flipping wildly. The hand snatching at the brim was slender, and the fingernails coated a glossy red. Violet liked the colour, but felt it was a little daring for herself.

The dog's lead, was crossing her ankles, as it sniffed at the nearby bin. Doubtless, some taste discarded scrap. Taking the opportunity, Violet bent down and patted the snuffling dog. As she did, she found herself blinking furiously, something in her eyes. Her eyes watered as she stood back up. Probably just the breeze, some dust, or pollen. The ignored her attentions, and she stepped over the leash.

"He's found something interesting..." she observed.

"She." the owner corrected, "She's a bitch."

Her language contrasted with her expression, such as she could make out. Only her mouth, was clear in the obscuring shadows dancing over her face.

"You like dogs?" she asked, more softly. "You seem to have an affinity."

"Yeah, I think they all just like the attention."

Violet nodded what she hoped would be understood as the end of their conversation. "It's chilly out, I hear a Hot Chocolate calling me." she joked.

It was that word. She hated it. So sexist, so foul. It still stung, it had been the last word her boyfriend had said to her. Said to her on Valentine's Day. She tried to dismiss it, forget it, put it behind her and move on.

The dorm was quiet, as expected in the middle of the first week. Everyone eager to prove they'd earned their place, and how diligent they were. Her own room felt like a haven of solitude. Scowling at the picture jammed into the edge of the mirror. She wanted to snatch it down, rip it to shreds, and stomp on the damned thing. However, she fought down her anger. It might still be dangerous, so she didn't even touch the damned thing.

She knew what she had to do. As a Super, Violet knew she could rely on her family for help, their experience invaluable. Even the government, might be helpful. She had her contact equipment, securely hidden. It was her emotions she wanted under control. She didn't want to start crying, like a child.

Pulling her luggage from the base of the wardrobe, she ran one finger along a particular seam. A laser scanned her fingerprint, with just the least glow of green light escaping. A soft ping, assured her she was past the first security layer. Unzipping a pouch pocket, a smooth glass circle was revealed.

Looking intently, in the centre, she waited for the retina scan, to allow her access to her supersuit, her encrypted devices, and ...

There was a dying warble, fart of electronic noise, and to Violet's absolute horror, a snake of smoke slipped from the seams of the case. The damned device had malfunctioned and destroyed her equipment. Smashing her fist in frustration against the case, only a few more puffs of smoke were driven from it, to spiral towards the ceiling.

Kicking the suitcase furiously, she threw herself back into the chair by the make-up table, and mirror.

Eyes welling up with tears of frustration, she rubbed at them, until she felt her panic receding. She could always use an ordinary phone. Surely, she could convince her parents of her true identity with that alone.

As Violet stopped dabbing at her eyes, she took a proper look at her reflection, at what was sure to be streaky make-up. Her nostrils flared, as she looked in fright at her eyes. Her sapphire blue eyes were gone, in their place a pair of dull brown eyes. Eyes that lacked any humanity. They matched her ears, Violet was staring fixedly at her own canine eyes.

No wonder the retina scan had failed. Through gritted teeth she shrieked at the ceiling, and kicked at the wall.
111111323.title: As Violet walked away, in a daze.

1111113233.content:
It was only lunch-time, but Violet felt like she'd been on her feet all day. Cradling the mug of hot chocolate, allowing it's warmth to seep into her chilly hands. Her glance flicked once more to the cupboard, and the suitcase there. The smoke was gone, but a bitter, metallic stink permeated the whole room.

She just felt a little grotty. Opening the window to let the fresh air in, and the smell out. Sitting on the edge of her bed, she tried to work out who was behind this. Assemble all the evidence, rule out some suspects and see where it could take her. The mobile phone, her ordinary one without encryption, sat on the side table. It's glittery pink cover inviting her to call for help, like a child, to phone her family.

However, she wasn't ready to do that. She wanted to go to them with a lead, a direction to go, with something to investigate. If she just phoned, she'd be the victim, not the crusading Super, hunting down her nemesis.

Mentally, she made a list.

1: It's someone who knows her real identity.

Good, that helps, even some of her allies didn't know that particular nugget of information.

2: It was probably a technology inclined Super, rather than a physically enhanced or gifted villain.

"Ah Shit..." she rarely cursed. It was more in frustration, it had to be 'The Dynamic Nature's Avenger'. In short, 'The DNA', the sexist son of a bitch, who'd been her boyfriend. The one who'd called her a bitch.

"Ah Shit..." That was him... Well, her that she'd met in the park. His powers had come on massively since they'd split. Previously, his nanite infused body had allowed him to morph his face for disguises, or reshape his hands to by-pass finger print scanners. He'd never managed a whole body change when they'd been going out.

Her skin crawled, as the world suddenly felt a lot less friendly. Anyone could be him, the friendly voice on the phone inviting her out for a coffee, or pretending to be a family member.

"Shit. Shit... Shit...." Equally, he might pretend to be her to the family, to lead them into a trap.

Phoning home, nobody answered, and she had to leave a cryptic message, asking them to phone her back. She couldn't even say what the problem was. Not in a phone message. So she loaded with the her Super name.

"Hi, Mom, It's Violet here. I'm having some difficulties adjusting. I hate to force, you to call me. But I need to talk, we need to talk. Errr, my other phone's been damaged. Please, just call, K' Bye."

Her dorm room should be fairly safe, so Violet decided to take a shower. Just a long relaxing one.

- - - - -

As she rinsed the last of the soapy foam from her body. She stepped out, rubbing her body vigorously dry. Leaving the small bathroom, with the towel wrapped around her, she felt the heat had gone from the room. The window having caught a gust, and blown wide open.

Hanging half out of the window, she felt the towel catch as she stretched. Grabbing the handle, the knotted towel surrendered, slipping open, and flashing her chest to the outside world. With a mortified squeak, she slammed the window shut. Or rather would have, hadn't the towel been hanging in the way.

Crouching down, her cheeks burning, and with barely a naked arm showing she pulled the towel in, and shut it with more violence than it needed. Despite the time, she pulled the curtains shut.
1111113233.title: Violet tries to work out who's behind this...

11111132331.content:
A wave of tiredness washed over her. Smothering a yawn, Violet curled up on top of the bed. She wasn't sure if it was stress, or the changes her body had gone through. But tucking her knees up against her chest, she was asleep before her head hit the quilt.

Her sleep was troubled, with nightmares about losing herself. The sun shone brightly through the closed curtain, telling her that only an hour or so had passed. But it was sneeze that woke her.

Her eyes took a moment to focus on the cause. With a startled cry quickly stifled, Violet saw the long, hairy, midnight black tail that had been brushing over her face.

Leaping off the bed, her hands reaching, dreading confirming what she suspected. Unfortunately, she found that the base of her spine was now hairier, and extended onwards to the luxurious bushy tail that had woken her.

On the verge of hyper-ventilating, she needed to flee the room. She no longer felt safe, alone. If the DNA could change her when she was alone, or had come in the room while she slept. A shudder ran down her spine. She couldn't face being alone, even a crowd would feel safer.

Slipping on her sunglasses hiding her canine eyes, she smoothed her hair, until the mobile floppy dog ears were equally well disguised. She needed a longer heavier skirt, to hide the latest addition. Checking her reflection, her disguise as if it were armour, she nodded her satisfaction, and left the room.
11111132331.title: Violet curled up atop the bed and fell asleep.

111111323311.content:
The sun had burnt away the worst of the clouds, as Violet walked back through the park. The sky a beautiful pale blue, with a scattering of brilliant, soft white clouds giving it texture.

She felt more at ease, more a part of the real... the normal world. There was a chattering from one tree, and a flurry of movement, as two squirrels bickered about nuts. On a path around the edge of the park, she spotted a couple walking hand in hand.

Her tension eased away, she'd called her family for support, and out here in the open in public. Well, she doubted the DNA would attack her openly. Taking a lungful of fresh air deep into her lungs, she held it there, savouring the aromas. She snorted, briefly as she caught her reflection. Her reflection looked like she had more curves, more of a bust. But as she breathed out, the familiar skinny Violet returned. It was hard going with her mother being so flexible, so curvy. But she'd taken after her father's side of the family, a stricter, more severe female line.

She reminded herself, she was here to get away from her concerns, from her worries. Hot Chocolate, she thought, that'll make her feel better. Besides, a nice full-fat milk Hot Chocolate would help her develop those curves she desired, if it went to the right places.

- - - - -

The girl behind the greeted her with a nod and a smile, as the door chimed her entry. There was only a smattering of people in. The rest would be in their classes, or maybe still in their beds.

Thanking the girl, Violet took the drink to an empty table. She leaped from the chair, the instant she sat down, clattering against the edge of the table. Heads turned at the noise, before turning back to their various screens and other distractions.

The fucking tail, she tried again, this time going more slowly, and smoothing the tail out of the way. The deluxe Hot chocolate, with the extra cream and marshmallows looked gorgeous. Her hands warming as she cupped the glass. Nose inches above it, she inhaled the rich chocolate scent.

The world felt safer, better when it had drinks like this in it.

Violet's happiness was scattered, as she felt her tail swish from side to side. The damned thing had a mind of it's own. Violet's skirt danced as her tail wagged. She hoped it would be mistaken as a breeze. Surely nobody would suspect it meant she had a tail. She dismissed the thought. But her calm was gone, her happiness shattered.

Her tail reflected that, and stopped wagging, allowing her skirt to settle.
111111323311.title: Violet headed for the University café.

choices: Snapping at a suspicious action, she pounced on 'the DNA'?
Leaving the café and her Hot Chocolate, she tried her phone again.
As a second thought, she went back for the card. It might be a clue?
1111113233113.content:
Wondering if she were squirming too much. Violet was very aware of the barista looking intently at her. Pulling a saucer out from beneath the counter, she popped it on a tray, and took it over to her.

Cagey, at the odd behaviour, Violet watched as the girl approached. Her smile was disarming, open and wide. She must have thought she was playing Cupid.

"A present from an admirer."

Putting the plate on Violet's table, she saw it was covered in plain biscuits, ideal for dunking. Beneath the heap of biscuits, was a small plain white envelope. Plain apart from the large heart shape drawn on it in thick marker pen.

Violet's stomach chilled, and she swallowed her fear. She politely thanked the girl. It was too terrifying for her to be more convincing, to be as friendly as she wanted to project.

Thankfully, she avoided any further questions, or interactions as the door chimed, and the girl returned to the till, and her counter.

She didn't want to risk the biscuits, as she knew who they were from. Instead, carefully she slid the envelope from beneath the pile of biscuits. Her hands shook too much for her to slip a fingernail inside and open the envelope. She took a calming breath and managed to slip a pinkie nail into the corner. Sawing the envelope open, a smallish card fell out.

Unfolding it, she read the contents.

Dog biscuits for my favourite bitch.

XOXOX

Next time you come here, I'll ask for a bowl of water for you.

The tingle in her fingers wasn't from nervousness. Once more she'd been dosed with his damned nanites. Her skin crawled, and she fought the urge to claw it all away.

Then she felt them fully go to work. Around her tail, she felt the prickling intensify. Her rear heat up, and the tickle of its progress. As subtly as she could, she jammed her hands down the back of her skirt. She needed to, dreaded confirming what she suspected. Her fingers came in contact with her fur. She didn't need to look to know it was thick, glossy and black, a perfect match for her hair. It was spreading outward from the base of her spine.

Her long skirt and baggy top allowed her to hide its advance. But she sat there as calmly as she could manage, as she felt a layer of fur spread around her hips. She felt it spread down her legs, too. Only stopping at mid-thigh, thankfully still hidden by the length of the skirt.

She felt it spread across her belly, rising relentlessly up her torso. Her fur tangling, weaving into her top. As her hand brushed over her stomach. Her breath caught, as her whole spine twitch, as her thighs clenched. Recognising the sensation, she continued more cautiously.

Violet discovered that she'd now developed a few new rows of nipples. She was another step closer to joining the canine kingdom. Giving the girl a tight smile, she left, not willing to give her ex the satisfaction of seeing how distressed she felt.

Her teeth clenched, she knew he'd never be able to resist watching her torment, his torture.
1111113233113.title: The girl leaves the counter, bringing her a plate.

11111132331132.content:
Her fingers shook as she tried once more to call her family. Number Unreachable, flashed across her screen. She plastered a rictus smile and waved good-bye as she fled the café.

The server's confusion was clear as she glanced back to the table and the abandoned biscuit. The sound of the door shutting cutting off her imminent cry that she'd forgotten them.

Scowling at her phone, she jammed it back in her bag. Stumbling, she headed back to the park. Her mind spinning she wasn't sure where she'd go, where she'd feel safe. Rubbing her hands against the crisp autumn air, she spotted how different her fingers looked. Thoughts of poor circulation, and gangrene made her boot scuff noisily against the pavement. The tips of her fingers were looking darker. She tried rubbing some feeling back into them, some warmth, some circulation.

They were coarser and almost leathery. She noticed a broader patch of black flesh, on the palm of her hand. But that couldn't be down to circulation. Bile rose in her throat, as it fell into place. This wasn't anything to do with bloodflow. This was the next stage of her punishment, this was her hands turning into paws.

Tugging her sleeves lower, she tried to hide her hands in her clothes. But they stubbornly refused. That was when Violet noticed that the back of her hands was gaining a layer of black hair... fur?

It wasn't thick, but again it made her nauseous. Leaning over a garden fence she threw up, into some thick bushes. It must have been worse than she realised, as the vomiting felt endless.

Her clothes hanging looser on her frame. She felt physically lighter. Ashamed, she left the bushes and crossed into the nearby park entrance. A scuffing, scraping sound caught her attention as she crossed the road. Stopping for a moment, she looked around, before remembering where she was, she passed through the park gate.

It felt like everyone's eyes were on her. She wanted to snarl back at them for looking at her. Any of them could be 'the DNA', and she didn't want to give him the satisfaction. Trying to fight her rising fears, she took a deep breath. She caught the aroma of the flowers, the scent of the mouldering leaves, the smell of freshly brewed coffee. When she identified the coffee blend, she gasped, the university café was downwind. She was smelling the one on the far side of the park. It was half a mile away.

Her hand couldn't reveal much as it rose to her face. But her nose was wet, and more prominent than it should have been.

Crouching down, she sobbed to herself, rocking back and forth. When she tried to stand again, her spine refused to co-operate. When she forced herself upright, she just collapsed forward. She landed on her forepaws. The light coating was now a complete layer of fur. Looking over her body, she found her feet had abandoned her shoes. As they'd shifted to paws, she recalled the scuffing sound as they'd fallen free while she was crossing the road.

Unable to stand properly, like a human, and worried how canine her face looked, Violet looked around for cover. A thick cluster of rhododendron caught her eye, their thick waxy leaves would give her cover. She felt her clothes catch on some of the branches as worked herself deeper into the undergrowth. Her rasping breath becoming more like panting, less capable of speech. Her body slimmer and more canine with her recent sickness. She had lost the last of the weight. Had her body been more human she'd have looked like an undernourished waif.
11111132331132.title: Leaving the café and her Hot Chocolate...

111111323311323.content:
It was red and black, though as she blinked, the colours seemed to shift, losing some of their vibrancy. She hissed at a flash of pain. A crack from her bones. Rational thought was becoming harder, concentration shattered by every distraction. The rustle of the leaves, the fragrance coming with every breath of the wind. She felt her instincts taking control.

Cowering at the noise. She crawled deeper into the undergrowth. Her body so transformed, she was coated nose to tail in slick perfect black fur. Her remaining clothes pulled loose and free by the entangling branches.

As her vision blurred, she howled in pain. Her paw prints in the soft earth, ripe with the scent of mould and the tinge of pollen. A familiar face came to mind... her mother... a whimper slipped out. A mix of pain and longing.

https://68.media.tumblr.com/525ec81ea68c...

She looked so disappointed, that a soft whine slipped out, her tail flopped back and forth pathetically, as the memory stirred. Her skull cracked and shifted, distorting her thoughts, distracting her. As she thought about the nice lady once more, she found no name... Instead memories of nice food, kindness, snuggles and pleasant aromas.

Another crack, and she struggled to remember where her owner lived... How she'd gotten lost... so lost...

Burying her howl of frustration, she perked up, as she scented someone familiar. Moving out from the protection of the greenery, tail wagging cautiously, she emerged.

He was holding his hand out, low for her to sniff. She paused for a moment, his scent was familiar. His smile didn't match his manner.

He was being cautious too. One slow step at a time, she drew nearer. Until he could gently reach her muzzle, and he softly stroked it. Moving nearer, he stroked her head, until she was wagging her tail more eagerly.

https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/564...

She looked up to him, hope in her eyes. His fur-ruffling hands were the perfect present, and she started to relax, panting heavily and soaking in his musky spice.

"There's my bitch... my favourite little bitch...." his voice was playful and light, the smile on his face broadening and becoming happier.

As he slipped the collar around her neck, and clicked the lead into place, a sense of belonging came to her. She rubbed against his strong chest, breathing deeply his aroma.

"Come along, girl. I promised you a bowl of water."

Tail wagging happily behind her, she bounced eagerly at her master's side to a café that was filled with an exciting range of tasty aromas.

A billowing cloud of residual smoke huffed from the outflow, as Violet dropped into the jungle. With barely a splash, she sank beneath the surface of the river. The sound of air-cars, and the distant chugging of boats heading for the horizon punctuated the night for Violet. Stifling a yawn, she found a cave beneath the cliff face, and set about preparing a camp-fire, and readying herself for a long wait and inevitable rescue.

Explosions sounded distantly through the compound, as Violet lay there. Slipping across the river like an eel, she made for the compound, filled with a determination to at least be clothed at the end of her mission. She didn't want to end her first solo mission successful but as a joke herself. She estimated that most of the personnel would have left the base by now, looking for an escape, by sea or air.

Fire licked against the inside of certain windows, and even with the dancing shadows she saw no silhouettes, shadows or people inside the base. The water poured from her skin, as she emerged hidden in the rushes on the side nearer the building. A large hole blown through the hangar door looked the easiest way in for Violet.

Leaving a trail of watery drips behind her, she ran low and fast for the open door. As her feet slapped onto the concrete, she belatedly realised she should probably do this while invisible. Flickering into invisibility, she made the rest of the journey as a trail of drying footprints. The final ones against the wall lacking any detail to mark them as bare feet.

Inside, the emergency lights had come on, a dark red glow reminding her of old movies about submarines 'running silent'. “Is red light meant to be quieter than white?” she wondered as she stepped inside. It made her think of the kitchen oven, and was positively cosy compared to the surrounding jungle.

Walking through the building, her senses alert for the sounds of other people. It just felt even eerier, both abandoned, but still very much alive with the fires and the damage still fresh, still ongoing. Shattered heli-flyers lay blown against the walls, their huge blades in pieces. Abandoned four-wheel-drive vehicles with their engines still running.

Focusing on her real priority, Violet looked around for a more human-sized door. For a door where a mechanic might emerge, somewhere that might lead to a changing room, or some other place where staff... or she could clean up and get dressed.

The strain of keeping herself invisible made her take cover. Being invisible felt like holding her breath, not a strain, and easily done. However, she had to let go at time, as if surfacing from a deep dive, some internal super-muscle needing a rest.

It might have been her imagination, but she felt like she was in the oven. Her skin drying out, cooking in the baleful red that made everything look darker. Holding her hand up, she verified she could still see it clearly, just as sharply as ever. It looked darker; hell, everything looked darker.

Running her hand across her temple, she brushed her hair off her face. Giving it a helpful puff, as she tried to blow the last strands aside. Even her hair was starting to feel frizzy, over-dry and... she dismissed it as her imagination... and even if it wasn't... it wasn't a priority.

"Ah s'pose," responded Violet, or Letty as she thought of herself, and it seemed to sound right to the 84 year old. She proceeded to carefully put things back in her purse, and then noted her teeth felt strange.

"Ma mouth feels funny, honey," she cackled, as she passed 87.

"Thas cuz...ya got...denchers," Bea told her.

"Whas that?"

"Ah said...ya got new chompers," Bea cackled, and then laughed heartily as Letty removed. Inspected them, and popped them.back in. Bea checked her new friend's hearing aid, making sure it was set correctly.

"That bettah dear?"

"Ya mean...kin ah hear ya? Yes...an thank ya... kindly."

"Oh, my panties...feel strange...too."

"Depends," Bea informed her.

"Depends on what?"

"Yer a wearin adult diapers,hon."

Violet looked down her pants. "All be...so ah am."

The process came to a halt a few seconds later. Letty checked herself out. The 92 year old adjusted her bifocals, and checked herself over. She wore white slacks with a red silk blouse, and had on red sequined tennis shoes. Her hair was a mass of white curls, and she had a black shawl on. There was a cane by her, that was red and orange, and she grabbed that and her purse.

"So...ah am an old lady...now...think....ah will fit in?"

"Yeah...and probly...get a look or two...from some...old man."

"Might be nice," she smiled "...though best...get a movin...gonna start...callin bingo...ya know."

"Ah tol ya that," Bea teased.

"Ya did...oh...right, ya did." Letty rattled, as the two ladies started to shuffle out.

Turning invisible, she fled the room. She had to get home. Had to!

1153.content:
It had passed so quickly, after Syndrome, and the Underminer, Violet's school years interrupted with painful memories. Not just a chaos of emotions and confused feelings, but also battles with villains. Usually Mr. Incredible of Elastigirl took the lead, but along with Dash, she'd been handed more and more responsibility, more and more freedom.

The world was opening up for her. She was eighteen and off to University. She grew in confidence, too. Her shyness a distant memory, something mentioned in passing, with fewer people believing her each time.

Oddly, and feeling a little selfish, she wanted the ordinary life. To experience the mundane, she wanted to be appreciated for her brains, for her choices, not for some... some ability.

Alone in her dorm room, she laid her books out for the next day, and took a last look in the mirror.

"Beware the Expander..."

The words seemed to come from nowhere, and Violet wasn't even sure she'd heard them, imagined them, or if they'd just drifted in the window.

However, as she felt a tingle ripple over her body. She raised her shield, and slapped one around the door handle she didn't want interrupted. Her friends discovering she wasn't just another student.

But the shield gave her no protection. The tingle shifted, moving from every inch of her skin, it centred on her chest, intensified there. And before Violet's unbelieving eyes, she watched in horror as her body betrayed her. As her body distorted, a shriek became a whimper, as a random thought hit her. Had she inherited her mother's abilities.

The voice destroyed that hope, that illusion.

https://68.media.tumblr.com/9c564997a2d3...

Raising her hands, she reached for her chest. But couldn't bring herself to close her fingers.

https://68.media.tumblr.com/a8e3dce0885b...

As if afraid of spreading a contagion, she withheld her hands.

https://68.media.tumblr.com/b1fee3844a97...

Her spine shook, as she fought to break .... what felt like a hypnotic grip.

https://68.media.tumblr.com/2c3a1825ace8...

But it was far, far too late. As the tingles evaporated, like bubbles in a hot breeze, she was left transformed.

12113112.content:
With Bob out of the house, and the kids out with Friends, Helen was free to catch up with the house-work. Despite her work beyond the home, it was oddly calming for her to get some hoovering, to wash the dishes. It made her feel more normal, her life more rounded and complete. She'd never give up the 'Super' life, the daring, the adventures, never leave it to the 'Guys', I don't think so... I don't think so...

She took out the duster, fantasies of Bob discovering her, ravishing her, filled her imagination as she effortlessly dusted the highest shelves. Though, as she finished the living room, and moved into the kitchen, she felt a twinge. Her arm spasmed, before flopping like wet pasta. It only lasted a moment before she regained control, but it shook her to the core.

Her legs wobbled from thigh to ankle, and she sank to the floor. Taking deep calming breaths, she wondered what was wrong, as she eased herself upwards. She felt that niggling doubt surface once more, her hips, her butt.

https://68.media.tumblr.com/16ff2446ac21...

In her imagination, they just felt so wide, so ... so Fat!

She tried to take control, she was a hero, she was Elastigirl! But the words rang hollow.

There was a tingle in the pit of her stomach, and clutching her hands to her tummy, she felt it pass through her, like it erupted from her... back.. well, really her back-side.

Her hands explored, carefully, hoping it was her imagination, that she wouldn't feel bigger, fuller, rounder... fatter. But she had to snatch her hands back as if stung. Her rump was indeed bigger.

https://68.media.tumblr.com/723823e9f3cd...

The word that echoed around her mind was 'Equine', her arse looked like it belonged on a horse.

121131123.content:
It was only as she crawled along the pine floor. Scrabbling noisily for every inch over the slippery wood, she looked to her hands. Before her eyes, her hands were curling into fists. Desperate and terrified, she tried to bite her fingers, to restore some sensation, some control. But it was useless.

The fist remained curled up. However, it didn't remain the same, as her skin darkened, shifting from a healthy pink, turning darker and darker. The blackness, rose as high as her wrists. While she watched fascinated, the fist also merged, individual fingers merging into one solid mass, into one solid hoof.

She recognised it as a horse's hoof, and thought once more of her fuller rump. She wondered if she'd brought it on herself, imagining it as equine. Was her subconscious driving this change?

A whimper slipped out, as she knew the phone was technology she'd not be able to use, she lacked the fingers, the simple manual dexterity.

There was a crack, and Helen doubled over in pain, it felt like her spine had shifted. The crack was followed by two leathery snaps. She levered herself back up. At least to stand on all fours. For balance that felt easier, behind her she saw the shoes she'd worn, and the tattered red ankle straps that held them in place. But it was her feet, or rather her hooves that caught her attention.

The same gnarled shape, the same blackened stumps, reaching up to form a light fringe of hair around her ankles.

Walking on her new hooves, she headed for the kitchen door. She was ungainly as a foal, unsteady, her hooves slipping and skidding removing all confidence from her movements.

Determined to take control, she leaned against one kitchen surface. She wanted to restore some semblance of humanity, to walk on her ... her hind feet. Propping herself heavily against the low cupboards, she stood up. Or tried, but her spine no longer bent that way.

She was reduced to a quadruped.

The humiliation escalated, as after several attempts she thought she'd lost control... That she'd lost... She felt her arse shift, and swell, and was terrified she was about to lose bowel control, a further step from humanity, and towards the simpler animal life.

She clenched, and squeezed frantically working unfamiliar muscles to avoid that.

Instead, a tear came to her eyes as she lost the battle. She couldn't even look away, as she felt herself lose. But the kitchen floor remained pristine, looking backwards, Helen saw a tail hang between her legs, it continued to extend dropping downwards, until she was greeted by a bushy horse's tail down almost to brush the floor.
121131123.title: Terrified, she crawled for the phone. She neede...

1211311232.content:
It was the oddest sensation, as she heard her skull crack. She wanted to try to hold it in place, but with her hands already transformed into hooves that was impossible. Besides, she wasn't even sure her wrist or elbow would even bend like that anymore.

Squeezing her eyes shut against the pain, she gritted her teeth. Breath huffing loudly from her nostrils. Cautiously, afraid of missing any developments, and at the same time terrified of spotting any, she opened her eyes.

The kitchen felt smaller, more confining. The need for space drove her towards the door out to the garden. Each pace was steadier, her gait a slow clopping walk. While not fast, at least walking on four hooves was starting to feel natural. Passing the chrome front of the fridge she caught her reflection. It was hard not to. Her vision was wider, though the colours were muted, it felt like she was seeing in high def, or wide-screen.

The reason why was clear in her reflection. Her head was more equine in shape. Her eyes separated by a muzzle that was lengthening as she stood there, hypnotised by the change. While it still lacked the fur that was spreading over the rest of her body, her face was grossly distorted.

Those flaring nostrils, were wider, bigger, more mobile. Those teeth she'd been gritting were also different, flatter, wider, and hidden behind more mobile lips. A mouth evolved for eating grass and chewing grains.

The reason for the kitchen feeling tight was also clear too, as her legs were longer, reaching up to where her shoulders would have been had she still been human. Atop those legs a horse's fuller torso, and a flash of movement caught her attention. Helen discovered her tail.

It was the same reddish brown as her hair. Summoning her anger, her resistance. Helen fought the changes, tried to stop... tried to slow these changes. However, nothing worked, as her body continued to become a chestnut brown coat of fur. She shook her head angrily, only to feel the flick of her mane, as it ran down her elongated neck. Her hair now a mane, and a match for her tail.

She wanted to rage against her helplessness, she was more terrified and alone than she had ever felt. She wanted to kick out, and keep on kicking until her fury was spent. Her thighs tightened, and her hind legs prepared to smash all around her.

A small core of her humanity, still fought against her animal fear. Still fought for reason. Manoeuvring her body between the kitchen units, while there was still enough room for her to manage. She made her way to the back door.

The progress was slow, with each dislodged pot, pan, and plate threatening her fragile control, as it crashed to the ground. Her equine instincts bubbling nearer the surface. Finally she was facing the door, she saw that her body was fully that of a horse. Her girth as wide as the door, her pale reflection in the glass showing a confused looking mare. Her dull brown eyes reflecting no hint of humanity.

There wasn't enough room to turn, so she had to head-butt the door repeatedly. Each impact bringing her closer to freedom. Each crash threatening her control. Until a final, solid wooden snap announced the surrender of the wooden frame. Relentlessly pushing forward, the door opened, until the busted lock feel free to land on the paving by the door.

It was a relief, simply to be outside, away from those restrictive spaces. She felt the doorframe brush her coat on both sides as she stepped out into the garden.

Looking around she found she'd only traded one prison cell for a larger one. Her longer muzzle allowed her to appreciate the scents of the garden better, the budding flowers, the freshness of the grass, even the vibrancy of the dew still glistening in the shaded parts of the garden. Instinct lead her there, and she found herself relaxing, as her teeth tore up clumps of the delicious grass. Straight away, she started to relax, her worries become a more distant memory. A confusing, unsettling, sense of discomfort.

She kept eating until even those thoughts faded. Feeding was enough to comfort her, with a toss of her mane, she looked at her former confinement, she was happy to have access to food, freedom and the sky above her head.

All human concerns were forgotten, all thoughts of family gone, her mind such as it was a tranquil pool of equine calm. Her needs reduced to food and comfort. Elastigirl not even a memory, the roan mare enjoyed the garden until the Parr family arrived home to find their mother missing, and a skittish horse wandering their garden.

1211311233.content:
Panicking, Helen nudged against the front door with her malformed shoulder. She huffed in frustration, but eventually the door gave way to Helen's increasing girth, and before she knew it she was able to press through, staggering onto her front lawn.

Helen took several cautious steps onto the grass, already much better to her hooves than her kitchen floor. Despite the changes in her hands, feet and spine, Helen's body was still mostly human, but that was soon to change. Helen groaned as her torso began to expand, straining the buttons on her blouse until they popped off, exposing her belly. As her rump widened, the tear made by her tail only tore further along her yoga pants. The waistband dug into Helen's flesh, but eventually that gave way as well, leading to her shuffling out of her pants. Helen was naked now, but that was the least of her concerns. Her ears, subtly thinning and lengthening, twitched as she took scope of her surroundings. Brays and whinnies could be heard across her suburbs, accompanied by an arrangement of scuffles and car-crashes. Helen could only deduce that whatever was happening to her must be affecting everyone in the neighborhood...possibly the entire city.

Helen let out a fearful whinny, catching the attention of a few other transforming equines. Helen dreaded the notion that her family might be going through the same changes as her. Helen's hazed mind was racing. She wanted to tend to her family, any of them, but...these people, all of whom are also being ravaged by their changes. Surely they were even more terrified than Helen was. Her instincts as a superhero began to creep up, conflicting her...

Helen let out a sigh, conceding that she was just not in the condition to be of any help. As she began to trot down the sidewalk, she found that walking on all fours had, in a matter of minutes, become far easier. She tensed her arms as her shoulders shifted themselves, restructuring her arms into forelegs. Her hind-legs felt much stronger as well, and with that Helen realized she no longer felt the tip of her tail brushing up against the ground as she walked. Her four limbs were slowly strengthening and expanding, beginning her proper proportions into a strong mare. If a mirror were nearby, Helen would be aware of how her human hair had begun to flicker off her scalp in strands.

Helen figured she wasn't too far gone until her change into a horse was complete—and she didn't want to think about what might happen to her human mind by then. With a sorrowful neigh, Helen relented that she would not be able to make it to her entire family at this rate. She took stock of her options...

121131123321.content:
Helen made her choice and began marching to the store. She silently prayed that Bob and Jack were still there, and didn't run off like she was. As the prospect of becoming a feral animal became more of an inevitability in her mind, Helen kept herself going that at the very least she could be united with her husband and youngest child—or, her mate and foal. Violet and Dash...they were adults by now, Helen had to trust that they could manage themselves.

She paid no mind to the itching sensation now all along her body, coating her bare skin in a rust-colored fuzz. Her nose crinkled as she felt her nostrils broadening, her lips feeling numb as she huffed in and out through her mouth. Her body felt strong, assertive, and the itching felt secondary, like the forming of sweat when out on an intense run, or in the heat of battle.

Turning a corner, Helen stopped in her tracks. There was a band of foals blocking the street, some in various forms of transformation, tattered school uniforms covering their changing bodies, and some had changed completely. It was a ruckus of whinnying, braying, stomping around. Helen's hero instincts crept up again, but it was no longer in the mindset of a superhero. It was now in the mind of a lead mare, one who would herd this pack of young, parent-less foals, who would organize them, lead them away from the chaos, and to food and water...

Helen snorted with frustration. She had already given up on one half of her family—then again, these children didn't even have a choice. Would it truly be cruel to give up on her family altogether, in the name of forming a new one?

121131123322.content:
Helen made her choice and began marching to the school. She silently prayed that Dash and Violet were still there, and didn't run off like she was. As the prospect of becoming a feral animal became more of an inevitability in her mind, Helen kept herself going that at the very least she could be united with her two eldest children—her two eldest foals. Bob and Jack...Bob was strong, and Helen knew he would look after his youngest, no matter what. She just hoped he would find a mare for himself...

She paid no mind to the itching sensation now all along her body, coating her bare skin in a rust-colored fuzz. Her nose crinkled as she felt her nostrils broadening, her lips feeling numb as she huffed in and out through her mouth. Her body felt strong, assertive, and the itching felt secondary, like the forming of sweat when out on an intense run, or in the heat of battle.

Turning a corner, Helen stopped in her tracks. There were three fully changed horses, a stallion and two fillies, nearby a park bench, their tattered clothes on the street below. The stallion had mounted one mare, both braying in ecstasy as they mated, while the other casually grazed the grass.

Helen's nether regions swelled at the sight, her darkened lips of her labia ached. For a flicker of a second, she forgot about her kids, the prospect of breeding new foals drove her mind crazy. Helen snorted, frustrated with herself for even considering the idea. Without context, those three looked like average, inconspicuous horses. Who's to say Helen would become them if she were to mate with the stallion?

Still, her mind evaluated the options. There's no telling what is going on with Violet and Dash, if they weren't just as bestial as the three in front of her. Was it even worth going to see them herself? The pep rally would undoubtedly be a crowded place—would Helen even be able to find her children?

Helen lowered her head, the heat between her legs overbearing. She had already given up on one half of her family—would it truly be cruel to give up on her family altogether, in the name of forming a new one?
121131123322.title: Dash and Violet have their pep rally today. Hea...

1211311233222.content:
Helen could not deny her budding animal instincts. She did not make her presence known, merely trotting up to the grassy corner at which the three other horses were settled and began to graze, patiently waiting for the stallion to cover his latest mare. Her broad teeth easily chewed and swallowed the grass, despite her head still being mostly human. Her mane was coming in well down her spine. As she waited, a part of her still considered fleeing, but she sighed, knowing she was too far gone by now.

Eventually, the stallion did dismount, and after a few moments of rest, he was aware of the newest mare closest to him. Helen flickered her tail, and the scent of her estrus made him snort through his nostrils. Helen squealed at the sensation of the stallion's nose under her tail, but began to whinny as he nibbled at her. Keeping her tail lifted, Helen winked her clitoris, as instinctively as if she was always a horse, and the stallion was easily receptive. With a quick hop, he was on Helen's back, and thanks to his practice with the other two mares, he was quick to find his mark. As he thrusted his shaft into Helen's equine vagina, she felt her jaw crack and her neck swell. Muscles and tendons restructured themselves as her face pushed forward, broadening her jaw, widening her snout. Helen's pupils dilated as her eyes bulged, spacing out to opposite ends of her lengthening face, and her long ears gradually migrated to their new place at the top of his head. As the bristling fur spread across her lengthened face, Helen gladly, not hesitantly, embraced her change.

The mare's inner walls clenched around her stallion's member as he lurched down, shooting his seed into her womb. Both whinnied triumphantly as they reached climax together, with the stallion hitching himself off his back and the mare grazing with her fellow broodmares. Eventually, the stallion joined them, eager to regain his energy after satisfying all three of his mares. The new band of horses paid no mind to the chaos that was unfolding around them, though the aggressive noises unsettled them. Eventually, the stallion lead his band elsewhere. They made their way down the paved roads, avoiding the panicked humans, some in the midst of transforming, others dressed in body suits, seemingly trying to contain the situation. They marched onward, until the large buildings were gone, the air was silent, and even the paved road had vanished. The band made their place there, interacting with other travelling bands.

Months passed. If the humans had indeed all gone, Helen would not have known. She wouldn't even have cared. She was a horse completely. Occasionally, her mind would drift off, she would recall having a different mate, and three different foals, but the memory was scattered and she quickly brushed it off. If it were a true memory, it didn't bother the mare. She felt the motion of her foal growing in her belly, and was thoroughly content with where she was now.

12131.content:
It was a rare week-end, with the whole family together. Well, apart from Jack-Jack, he was with Edna being assessed for his abilities, and measured for a super suit.

A smile came to her face, as she imagined the 'Dahling!', of Edna Mode, as she doted on the baby. The rattling of the pot lid as the water boiled brought her back to the moment. The meal was almost ready, and she felt like a mother and a wife. The thought of being a wife, tonight, made her blush, the idea of their bedroom antics, with the thrill of the kids next door. She felt daring and wild, as she hadn't for a while.

Plating up the food, she was still flushed as she put it on the table.

"If the kitchen's hot, you can open a window...."

She smiled at the innocence of Bob's assumption. The kids were concentrating on the hot food steaming on their plates. Neither notices as a long arm stretched beneath the table giving Bob a playful squeeze. The chair scraped achingly on the floor, as it leaped backwards at Bob's startled twitching reaction. It was his turn to blush, as he pulled himself back to the table.

Returning to it's normal length Helen started cutting her steak. Relaxing and enjoying the simple sound of a family eating together. None of the family detected the faint lemon smell filling the house, nor the hiss from the canister it came from. Too late, Bob saw Dash and Violet yawn, deep and wide, his foggy brain only realising it's significance.

"Helen..." he stood up, the room spinning as he reached his feet. Helen tried to rise, but ended up slumped backwards over the chair. Bob managed a couple of staggering, heavy footsteps, before collapsing, overcome by the gas. Distantly his mind still admiring Helen's body, and her the way even now, her bust was gorgeously displayed, so proud, so prominent. He sprawled awkwardly on the floor.
12131.title: Culture Shock – race change

121312.content:
Helen woke, alone and strapped to a table. She smiled to herself, slipping out of these bonds would be too easy. Focusing on her arms she lengthened and thinned it to slip from the cuffs. Pulling up, she was startled to feel the padded woollen cuffs around her wrists just as tight as ever.

Now more scared, she tried again. Her other arms, this time. A frown of concentration furrowed her brow. But once more, her body refused to respond. She was cut off, from her elastic abilities. Hopefully only temporary, she thought, as she clung to hope.

Her struggles had not gone unobserved, as a metallic voice came from a speaker in the darkness.

"Awake again." It sounded confident and calm. But was soon replaced with the sound of boots walking slowly over a stone floor, the echoes suggesting she was in a big chamber. Stopping at her side, she felt the buckles being released by a masked man. His uniform was all in black, and reinforced with armour. His face hidden behind a blank kevlar mask. Acting instantly, instinctively, Bob pushed his wife down low, as the beam cut off. Leaping for the door, he slapped the lights back on. He dashed to the window, his fingers digging into the frame, as they curled in anger at this assault... in his own home. The wood cracked and splinted, unobserved by either of them.

Eyes blinking wildly he looked out into the dark garden. The indistinct shapes hard to see, but there was no trace of anyone there anymore.

"ボブ", she answered with a nod. Her eyes pleading for him to understand. The hint of his name mangled but clear enough for him to nod his comprehension, and see that behind those stranger's eyes, a friend lurked.

A beam of green light swept across the room. A high-tech aircraft hung in the air, the beam was fired by a figure lurking in the door of the craft. As the light swung towards him, he heaving himself sideways, Bob crashed into the wall. Half buried their it took him a moment, break free.

The entire time, Helen was outlined in a green halo. Ripping an arm free he smashed the wall, diving to intercept the beam, to save her. The beam snapped off, before he could put himself in harm's way. The whine of engines rose in pitch, as the craft powered up, and sped off into the darkness. Only the sound of a sonic boom giving a hint to it's direction.

Helen started to shriek in agony. Clawing at her clothes she felt like she was being dipped in acid... or as if her clothes were soaked in acid. She clawed wildly at them, tossing them to the corner of the room. She stared at them, as if expecting them to attack, leap back, their visceral betrayal impossible to comprehend. It was only once she was completely naked that her shrill cries lessened. Her heart beating out of her chest, as she realised the pain was gone. With a gasp, she stopped her cries.

Aghast in horror, he almost crushed her in his embrace, as he hugged her to his side. Helen quivered from head to toe, every muscle trembling in shock. For comfort and modesty, Bob took her dressing gown, and slipped it onto her shoulders.

Helen erupted forward, her shoulders twitching and writhing as she pulled free from the dressing gown. She wanted to stamp on it, but was afraid it would sting her once more. Recoiling from the pooled dressing gown, she hugged Bob.

Whatever that green beam was, or did, it was impossible for her to wear clothes until this was fixed. She shuddered as waves of humiliation washed over her.

125112211211.content:
A couple minutes after leaving their new house, Violet couldn't help but ask. "Are you sure that Dad and Dash can handle things while we're gone? In particular, Dash?"

Helen Parr awkwardly smiled. "Oh, I'm sure they can handle it while we're gone. They've managed before, right?"

Violet smirked. "I suppose so." before promptly changing the subject "So, where are we going to anyways?"

Helen grinned. "Oh no place special, just Turquoise Beach is a-"

Violet cheerfully interrupted "What?! The Turquoise Beach?! How did you manage to do that? The bill for that place is is-"

Helen jokingly added. "Incredible?"

Violet stared at her mom, annoyed at the pun. "Yes. Incredible." She's heard that pun more times than she count and somewhere along the lines, it's humor dimmed.

Her mom continued. "Well, nothing too big. Our superhero agency is reimbursing our weekend trip as long as we do a small token of-"

Violet facepalmed. "What are we going to do?"

Helen nervously finished. "Just give a little pep talk to some new inspiring superheroes is all, it should be easy."

Violet nodded anxiously. "Okay, but I'm not sure I have much pep talk in me. I mean, I just recently started."

Helen laughed contently. "You'll be fine sweetie. Now, tell me, what are some of the things we can do at this beach? You mentioned in passing a week ago."

At that, Violet continued on for a couple hours on all the amazing amenities of their vacation stay.

Right around the time that Violet was running out of new subjects, the two pulled into the venue that they'd be staying at for the superhero pep talk. "Alright sweetie, we're here. Let's get ready. This shouldn't take long, now should it?"

As they did so, Violet noted how few cars were nearby and the dense foliage near them. This place was probably being closely monitored by the government outside it.

Minutes later the two found them swarmed by about ten prospective superheroes in civilian clothing. Slews of questions were asked, such as...

How do you decide on your suit and superhero name?

How hard is it to maintain both a superhero and non superhero life?

How can you be so successful?

After a good fifty or so minutes of answering questions, the crowd died down and many of the prospective superheroes left content with their answers. But it was around this time that Helen and Violet noticed the last person in the room, a shy lady in her 20s, dotting back and forth.

Her hair was straight and long and eyes light green. She wore a simple outfit, a pink t-shirt and jeans, and from her outward demeanor seemed quite average.

Helen contently walked up to her, with her daughter following her, and asked the 20 something lady. "Can I help you?"

The lady nervously said. "I-I don't know. I-I- You're my hero, but uh.."

Helen smiled. "It's okay dear. Just tell me what you can do and what you need help with."

The lady took a deep breath. "Okay.. well, let me first start with, again, you're my hero. My superhero name is Little Missy and-"

Violet perked up at that name. "That name kinda sounds like it should be for someone a little-"

The newcomer looked deadpanned. "younger? Right?"

Violet nodded.

The lady's nerves went away slightly. "Well, yeah, that's sorta related to my problem. Kinda. My power is the ability to change people's ages. I can change mine perfectly." At that, she regressed herself down to a 10 year old with her clothes changing size to match. "but I can't seem to get the knack of using it on others."

Helen mused. "That's quite the power. I'm glad to see you on the right side. But I do have some troubling news."

The little girl gulped, turning herself back and asking "What would that be?"

Violet looked up as her mom told her what she was thinking as well. "The only way to get better is to practice. Practice makes perfect they always say."

The lady's shoulders went over as she sighed. "That's what I thought."

Helen tried her best to relieve her. "It's okay, you can practice on us, after all, the crowd already left."

Violet turned to her mom, looking nervous, who shot her a confident smile back in reassurance.

The lady puffed her nerves back and happily replied. "Thank you, thank you very much. You have no idea how hard it is to practice on others."

Helen smiled contently. "It's okay dear. I understand. Just remember, baby steps. Don't try anything too difficult."

The lady took a deep breath. "Okay.. baby steps. Nothing too difficult. Baby steps..."

Violet watched as the lady backed up before glaring at her mom. In the span of the second, faster than Violet could process, she saw her mom regress all the way back into a baby!

All the teenager could say is. "What the? Mom?!"

Little Helen looked down at her body and could feel the newly placed diaper between her legs. All she could do was wail at the top of her lungs. "WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHH!" as the two 'gwow nups' tried to solve this.

Violet quickly turned her head to the lady. "What did you do? Turn my mom back?"

The lady started to panic. "I-I.. Ugh, I did it again I thought of babies instead of baby steps. Stupid me, stupid stupid me!"

What on earth was going to happen?

Her clothing was a blue silk top with long sleeves and black slacks, with low heels. A moment later she wore glasses as well.

"I look like some middle aged woman....eeek!"

"Oh honey, do you really think that I would stop there...with you in your mid forties? Think again."

Indeed, the years continued to fly by, her hair going ever grayer and she fanned herself as the first wave of hot flashes hit as she passed 49.

"Someone please turn on the air, and please stop this, please, please quit!!!"

"Not a chance, but thanks for asking."

The aging continued, as Mirage raced passed 64 to 65. She now had jowls starting, and her hair had touches of white in it. There was a second set of under eye bags, her cheekbones stood out, and she had a beaded chain on her bifocals. She wore jeans, a red silk top with long sleeves and the collar up, some white tennis shoes, and there was a scrap boozing project off to one side.

"Oh my, I am into retirement...I think I shrunk an inch too."

"And we aren't done yet."

She kept going, her hair becoming more white by the second, and got a bit curly. Her eyelids started to droop, and lines showed on her forehead. Her jowls hung a touch, and her throat looked wobbly. She wore beige slacks and a lime green top with pink glasses on a beaded chain, and a light brown shawl draped across her shoulders as she leaned on a cane a moment later. As she watched, her teeth dropped out one after another to be replaced by dentures. She wore a girdle under everything, as well as support hose.
It all came to a stop, as a woman of of 88 stared at her image, and adjusted the string of pearls she wore as she admired her shoulder length white perm.

"Oh dearie me...ah am...an...old lady. Help me...to ma...rocking chair dearie...wherever...ya are."

A moment later...

13533.content:
This time, the beam crackled with brilliant red sparkles. Mirage felt her thoughts soften, her focus... her attention... thingy...

It became harder... impossible to think. She felt her breath billowing, the air heaving from her nostrils sending frosty white whorls into the air. Even that felt wrong, too obvious, too much. Bones cracked everywhere, her face erupted in pain, every joint shrieking in protest.

Squeezing her eyes closed against the pain, it felt like it was over in an instant. The cracks still undeniable, their cause still impossible to avoid. But now, as they reached her ears the pain was absent. Her ears were more flexible, more agile.

Blinking, once, twice. She couldn't see her transformed body. But she knew her humanity was gone, her hands and feet were dull, giving no clues, returning no sense of warmth, cold, softness of anything.

A long hank of platinum blond hair fell across her face, obscuring her vision further. She wanted to snarl her amusement, at this insult, keeping her blond while taking everything away. But she couldn't even form a snarl, her mouth beyond her control.

But that too was a clue. It helped her realise how wide her view was, how different things looked. The colours were duller, but she could see a much wider view than before. Something she hadn't realised until that lock of hair had fallen across her face.

Once more the beam cut off, releasing her. She tossed her head. That was weird, her neck was long and mobile. Then head snapping around she took in her broad back, the soft fur coat, leading down to her tail. She was a horse. A beautiful palomino mare.

https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/ori...

She tried to swear, to speak. But her lips blubbered, and she nickered like the horse she truly was now.

1433112.content:
Helen didn't know where the idea for a trip to the zoo sprang up. All she really wanted was some time with her kids.

Helen and Dash have not only been readjusting to their new lives, they've been thriving. After Syndrome, after the Omnidroid, after the new house, the Parr family have been closer than ever before. Violet had been blossoming, both at school and at work, and Dash's restlessness had finally quelled once he was able to let off some steam. Who would have thought that a side-job as a team of super-heroes had allowed Helen's children to come into their own?

Which is where Helen's newfound distress came from. Not that her kids might be hurt flying around fighting evil. The two of them were already far more self-reliant and resourceful that she was at their age. Helen's nagging worry was just the mere fact that her eldest kids were growing up. So when Bob took Jack-Jack to the NSA facility to get a check-up on the infant's budding powers, Helen might have thought of the zoo to hearken back to more innocent times she had when her two oldest were closer in age to her youngest. It wasn't either Violet or Dash's first choice, but they

To Helen's surprise, the two ended up being enthralled with the attractions at the Metroville Zoo. They were exhibits the two have seen before when they were younger, but looked upon all the animals with fresh new eyes. It warmed Helen's heart to see Violet and Dash briefly step away from the cynicism they would no doubt encounter soon enough and have that child-like fascination with the world still glimmer in their eyes. Eventually, they made it to the petting zoo, filled with pigs, chickens and a small enclosure in the corner housing farmhand billy goats. Helen raised her eyebrow at the odd sight of there only being two goats, a full-grown buck and a small kid. Helen thought back to her own kids, and felt pity for the little goat, whoever his mother is not being present. In fact, Helen, Violet or Dash could notice that no other people had entered the petting zoo after them...

Violet had lowered herself down on one knee, her open hand filled with feeding pellets. The buck was feeding out of Violet's open hand while the young girl pet him along his neck. Dash was to the goat's side, petting his fur along his spine.

There was something undeniably wholesome to Helen at the sight of her children giving affection to the animal, but there was something else that was unnerving about it. Not the kids' demeanor, but their literal physical appearance. Both Violet and Dash looked as though they filled out their clothes a bit more than Helen remembered. Violet began to wobble on her kneeling stance in front of the goat, and eventually even Dash seemed as though he was losing his balance. Even from a few yards away, Helen noticed something peculiar about her children's hands as they pet the goat...

Helen smiled warmly, remembering her feelings of sorrow at the young goat for not having a maternal figure around. She lowered herself to the ground, seating herself as opposed to kneeling like her daughter. The little goat was clearly a newborn, being roughly the size of a large cat, his horns only budding. Helen's maternal instincts heightened, her heart sinking at the thought that this goat's mother might have died giving birth. Helen grew flushed as her heart swelled, beginning to feel the same sense of motherly pride when Dash and Violet fed from her as infants, and how Jack-Jack used to do less than a year ago.

As Helen looked up, she noticed her breath was trembling. The thoughts brewing in her head would have been crazy, but whipping her head back around, seeing the absence of any other zoo-goers was merely justification in her rationale.

With a tear and a gruff, the buck tore a hole in Violet's shirt with his teeth, and slowly tugged the cloth off of Violet's body. Helen might have been otherwise outraged, but she felt nothing but gratitude for the buck for helping her daughter out of what surely felt unbearably constraining. Violet herself let out a feeble bleating noise in approval to the gesture.

The whole thing made Helen more aware of her own discomfort. She was in the midst of discarding her bra when she decided to just undress completely. Awkwardly staggering to her feet, Helen kicked off her flats and shimmied out of her jeans and panties. Her bra became especially cumbersome to remove, as Helen found her middle fingers bloated just like her children, but eventually she managed to unclip it from behind, letting her breasts jiggle free and leaving her naked out in the open, with not an ounce of shame.

Helen lowered herself back down to the ground on her hands and knees, then laid to the side. Instinctively, the kid goat stepped to Helen's chest, and began suckling upon her breast. Helen let out a sharp exhale through her nose, petting the goat as he drank from her, as if she was her own mother...
143311222.title: Helen had a crazy thought. She reached for the ...

choices: Awkwardly, Helen staggered over to her children...

1433112221.content:
Helen had dozed off, having felt so utterly content with the kid goat suckling upon her teat. Waking up, Helen let out a rough bleat, her throat suddenly feeling much rougher than before, as the shoulder by which was leaning onto the ground as she laid on her side felt uncomfortable. Helen blinked her eyes rapidly, and huffed through her mouth as she gathered her bearings. Part of her face was extended past her eyes, not unlike an animal's snout. Looking up, the lowered sun indicated it was the late afternoon, approaching closing hours for the zoo. Helen twisted her neck as she attempted to lift herself off her side. She was not alarmed by her hands and feet having become split hooves, nor how her torso was far more bloated than before. As someone who changed shape, something like this did not alarm Helen, even as she was in a dreary stupor.

As Helen staggered onto all fours, she felt much more natural in this stance, the shoulder formerly hunched against the dirt floor beginning to feel relieved. A pair of floppy, fleshy ears padded against Helen's head as she shifted her body around, and her new snout-like nose felt wet and tingly as she began breathing through it. Looking around the pasture, Helen saw Violet and Dash, looking what Helen felt like. Their bodies had also reshaped to more fitting bovid proportions, with fully functioning legs and muzzles. They trotted around the enclosure naturally, as if they had always been this way, playing with the smaller kid. The older buck was by himself, drinking from a steel trough. Like Helen, Violet and Dash were naked, their clothes scattered around the ground with various tears and teething marks, and their bare skin was lightly coated with fur, black for Violet and brown for Dash. If Helen could see herself, then she could see that her appearance were the same as her children, if not coming along further, with Helen's horns and tail both longer than Violet or Dash's.

Helen attempted to speak, but all that came out were rough bleating noises, ones that nonetheless caught the attention of the others, the kid in particular. The baby goat trotted toward Helen, but seemed to walk past her. Helen didn't even notice that her human breasts had receded as her arms realigned into bovid forelegs during her rest. The baby goat, however, was quick to trot over and begin suckling upon Helen's new bloated teats hanging between her hindlegs, full and heavy as if she had very recently given birth.

Helen rolled her thick tongue around her mouth. The feeling of her body, the sight of her children at play, Helen's mind wanted to tell her this was natural, that she should feel comfort and contentment, but a nagging presence bothered Helen's mind, albeit a fleeting one. In the midst between rational and instinctual, Helen was indecisive as to what to do next...
1433112221.title: Some hours passed...

14331122212.content:
"Ahh, so the serum worked nicely, I see..." a feminine voice spoke out.

Helen looked over to the opening of the enclosure, to the human walking towards her. She had vibrant red hair, falling down to her waist behind her, half of her gorgeous face obscured by a set of goggles with a swirled, disorienting design to the eyes. Her tall, hourglass-shaped body was adorned in a tight white jumpsuit, and her floor-long cape kicked up dust as she sauntered over to Helen, her gloved hands perched on her hips.

She reached out to Helen, petting her on the head. "Y'know, I have no idea where the whole 'goat' thing came from," Mezmerella mused to herself. "Honestly, I could have turned you into anything. My powers could easily ward off any busybodies who might interrupt. Still, I can't complain, save for how suprisingly easy this all was."

Helen looked up into Mezmerella, and the villainess smirked looking into her horizontal pupils. "Though, if there's a part of you that's still curious, I was the one who put the idea to come here in your head. Post-hypnotic suggestion and all."

With her hand still petting Helen, Mezmerella looked out to the rest of the goats. "Oh, and the other two? That's your husband and other kid. I dealt with them shortly after they left this morning. I mean, what kind of monster would I be to separate a family?" the super-villain continued to monologue to herself, boastful at how easy it was to subdue the big new super-family that brought the Supers out of the woodwork, what fun it was going to be at leading the NSA on a wild goose chase to track down the missing Incredibles, but the words became white noise to Helen. As Jack-Jack continued nursing her teats, Helen's previous feelings of pride and contentment swept back, and she felt at ease. The zoo staff were not curious about the addition of a family of goats in the petting zoo; Mezmerella saw through to that. Before the end of the day, Helen's coat of fur had grown in, a lovely red-brown, and so had Violet and Dash's. The Parr family were goats in mind and body, though they remained a loving family all the same.

In her final moments of rationality, Helen conceded that she had gotten her wish all along: She and her family were together forever now, no conflicts, challenges or expectations to burden them for the rest of their lives.

151.content:
Bob was driving back from work, trying not to crush the steering wheel in his fingers. Another frustrating day as a cube dweller, face inches from the computer monitor, with a head set strapped to his ear.

As he turned into the housing estate, he spotted a craft hovering low in the sky. A cone of sparkling purple light came from the underside. He didn't need to see anymore. It had to be over his house. The floor of car gained a stamped footprint, as he crushed the accelerator to the floor. Only just stopping before pushing it through to the road. The car barely sped up.

Eyes alert for bystanders, and supers, he turned into his own street. It looked empty. Swiftly parking the car, under a tree, he slipped from his car, completing his transformation into Mr. Incredible, slapping his black mask across his eyes.

His heart skipped a beat, as he thought about who was home. Dash was meant to be at an after-school club, and Violet had sent him a text about being late. The car door handle still in his hand crumpled as he thought about Helen, and the idea of any harm coming to her.

With no other plan, he charged into the house, looking for his wife. A little surprised there was no resistance as he smashed through door, and crashed straight into Elastigirl. Already in her red and black outfit, her eyes widened in the moments before they fell tumbling and rolling down the hallway, and in a ball of thrashing stretching limbs into the living room.

As the room spun before their eyes, Bob couldn't keep the delighted smile from his face. Whatever happened they were together, they could face it together. At least, that was what he thought.

His smile felt odd, well, not odd, but off. Or something different.

Still dizzy from their tumbling entrance to the living room, and giddy with relief, his tongue darted out, moistening his lips. It was then that he tasted the strawberry lipstick on them, and moments later he caught his reflection in the glass top of the coffee table.

Before his disbelieving eyes, he saw Elastigirl, her tongue licking her lips, and her eyes widening in dawning horror. Looking around she spotted her former body, one hand on his forehead, groaning, as he sat up.

His groaning cut off suddenly, the hand shifting from his forehead to his throat, before slipping down to his chest.

Bob got to her feet, the extra width in her hips make her feel unbalanced, her body morphed, trying to take on a more familiar, a more intimidating shape. Alas, it didn't work quite as he intended. His new Elastigirl bust grew and grew, far beyond what he'd ever seen on his wife, even in the bedroom. Each breast bigger than her head, and threatening to throw her off balance as it sloshed around in unfamiliar and disturbing ways.
151.title: Bob Parr

The rules for this interactive story are as follows:
